intro: Brosimum turbinatum, commonly known as the Turbinated Brosimum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and parts of the Amazon Basin. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
